title: Breath
data:
- *For other uses, see [Breath (disambiguation)](/wiki/Breath_\(disambiguation\) "Breath (disambiguation)").*

Many monsters have **breath weapons** which they can deploy against you as a ranged attack. Breath weapons are often vexing to low-level characters who do not have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") or the appropriate [resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Types of breath weapons](#Types_of_breath_weapons)
- [2 Defending against breath weapons](#Defending_against_breath_weapons)
- [3 Use of breath weapons while polymorphed](#Use_of_breath_weapons_while_polymorphed)
- [4 Use by pets](#Use_by_pets)
- [5 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [6 References](#References)

## Types of breath weapons

There are eight types of breath weapon:

| Weapon                                                  | Monsters using it                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile")    | D [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon")                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [Fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")                               | d [hell hound pup](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup") d [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound") D [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon") N [red naga](/wiki/Red_naga "Red naga") D [Ixoth](/wiki/Ixoth "Ixoth") |
| [Cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold")                               | d [winter wolf cub](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub") d [winter wolf](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf") D [silver dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon") D [white dragon](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon")     |
| [Sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") gas                        | D [orange dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon") W [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul")                                                                                                                                     |
| [Disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") | D [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")                                                                                                                                                                          |
| [Lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning")                | D [blue dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon")                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [Poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") gas                     | D [green dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon") ' [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem")                                                                                                                            |
| [Acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid")                               | D [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon")                                                                                                                                                                       |

The D [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon") can attack with any breath weapon, chosen at random when attacking.

In [3.6.1](/wiki/3.6.1 "3.6.1"), poison breath also leaves behind a short-lived trail of [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud").

## Defending against breath weapons

There are basically four ways to defend against a breath weapon:

- Have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"); any breath weapon that hits you will then be reflected, though all monsters are immune to their own breath weapons.
- Have the appropriate [resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance"), either intrinsic or extrinsic. This however does not protect your gear from [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold"), or [lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning"). [Disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"), on the other hand, does extend to armor that would otherwise disintegrate.
- Fight the monster in [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee"). A monster will never use its breath weapon if it can hit in melee, unless it is [impaired](/wiki/Impaired "Impaired").
- [Cancel](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation") the monster. It will then cough instead of blasting when it tries to use its breath weapon.

## Use of breath weapons while polymorphed

While you are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a monster with a breath weapon, you can launch a breath blast by using the `#monster` [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"). This uses 15 points of [magical energy](/wiki/Magical_energy "Magical energy").

## Use by pets

In [3.6.1](/wiki/3.6.1 "3.6.1") and later, [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") can use their breath weapons against both [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile") and [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") monsters.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Unlike melee attacks, they can sometimes target monsters of much higher [level](/wiki/Level "Level") than themselves, although attacking anything 5 or more levels higher that the pet is increasingly unlikely.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Pets are much less likely to use a breath attack if they're hungry.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) They will avoid to breathe in your (or other pets') direction, assuming you are not [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") or [displaced](/wiki/Displaced "Displaced") and they're not [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) However, they can still hit you on a [rebound](/wiki/Rebound "Rebound").

## SLASH'EM

The following new [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") [monsters](/wiki/Monster_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Monster (SLASH'EM)") have breath weapons:

| Weapon                                               | Monsters using it                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") | D [shimmering dragon](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shimmering dragon (SLASH'EM)") ' [diamond golem](/wiki/Diamond_golem "Diamond golem") |
| [Fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")                            | ' [ruby golem](/wiki/Ruby_golem "Ruby golem")                                                                                                       |
| [Cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold")                            | ' [steel golem](/wiki/Steel_golem "Steel golem")                                                                                                    |
| [Sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") gas                     | f [kamadan](/wiki/Kamadan "Kamadan")                                                                                                                |
| [Lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning")             | ' [sapphire golem](/wiki/Sapphire_golem "Sapphire golem")                                                                                           |
| [Poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") gas                  | D [deep dragon](/wiki/Deep_dragon "Deep dragon")                                                                                                    |

In addition, ' [crystal golems](/wiki/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem") use a random breath weapon like the Chromatic Dragon.

Breath

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For other uses, see Breath (disambiguation).

Many monsters have breath weapons which they can deploy against you as a ranged attack. Breath weapons are often vexing to low-level characters who do not have reflection or the appropriate resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Types of breath weapons
  • 2 Defending against breath weapons
  • 3 Use of breath weapons while polymorphed
  • 4 Use by pets
  • 5 SLASH'EM
  • 6 References

Types of breath weapons

There are eight types of breath weapon:

Weapon Monsters using it
Magic missile D gray dragon
Fire d hell hound pup
d hell hound
D red dragon
N red naga
D Ixoth
Cold d winter wolf cub
d winter wolf
D silver dragon
D white dragon
Sleep gas D orange dragon
W Nazgul
Disintegration D black dragon
Lightning D blue dragon
Poison gas D green dragon
' iron golem
Acid D yellow dragon

The D Chromatic Dragon can attack with any breath weapon, chosen at random when attacking.

In 3.6.1, poison breath also leaves behind a short-lived trail of poison clouds.

Defending against breath weapons

There are basically four ways to defend against a breath weapon:

  • Have reflection; any breath weapon that hits you will then be reflected, though all monsters are immune to their own breath weapons.
  • Have the appropriate resistance, either intrinsic or extrinsic. This however does not protect your gear from fire, cold, or lightning. Disintegration resistance, on the other hand, does extend to armor that would otherwise disintegrate.
  • Fight the monster in melee. A monster will never use its breath weapon if it can hit in melee, unless it is impaired.
  • Cancel the monster. It will then cough instead of blasting when it tries to use its breath weapon.

Use of breath weapons while polymorphed

While you are polymorphed into a monster with a breath weapon, you can launch a breath blast by using the #monster extended command. This uses 15 points of magical energy.

Use by pets

In 3.6.1 and later, pets can use their breath weapons against both hostile and peaceful monsters.[1] Unlike melee attacks, they can sometimes target monsters of much higher level than themselves, although attacking anything 5 or more levels higher that the pet is increasingly unlikely.[2] Pets are much less likely to use a breath attack if they're hungry.[3] They will avoid to breathe in your (or other pets') direction, assuming you are not invisible or displaced and they're not confused.[4] However, they can still hit you on a rebound.

SLASH'EM

The following new SLASH'EM monsters have breath weapons:

Weapon Monsters using it
Magic missile D shimmering dragon
' diamond golem
Fire ' ruby golem
Cold ' steel golem
Sleep gas f kamadan
Lightning ' sapphire golem
Poison gas D deep dragon

In addition, ' crystal golems use a random breath weapon like the Chromatic Dragon.
